intro: Leptodermis parkeri, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its fleshy, dark green leaves and clusters of showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive. Its compact growth habit makes it suitable for indoor gardening and container planting.
